questions.question: What is the primary role of a Digital Forensics Examiner?
options: A. Investigating and analyzing digital evidence

questions.question: Which of the following is a key goal of digital forensics?
options: A. Identifying and preserving electronic evidence

questions.question: What is the first step in the digital forensic process?
Which of the following file systems is commonly analyzed in digital forensics?
Which tool is commonly used for disk imaging in digital forensics?
What is the purpose of hashing in digital forensics?
options: A. To verify the integrity of digital evidence

questions.question: Which legal principle ensures the integrity of collected digital evidence?
Which type of digital evidence is stored in volatile memory?
What is steganography used for?
options: A. Hiding data within other files

questions.question: Which organization provides guidelines for digital forensic investigations?
Which forensic tool is widely used for mobile device investigations?
What is live forensics?
options: A. Analyzing data on a running system
D. Creating forensic reports after case closure

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of an anti-forensics technique?
What is the goal of forensic data carving?
Which protocol is commonly analyzed in network forensics?
Which forensic tool is used to analyze Windows registry data?
What type of evidence is obtained from browser history analysis?
options: A. User activity on the internet

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of metadata?
What is the primary objective of forensic reporting?
options: A. Documenting and presenting findings in a legal manner

questions.question: Which type of analysis is performed to identify hidden data within a file?
